pullrequest.title: Remove TinyXML symbols from public API

content.raw: We usually don't deprecate features on minor releases and do that on the next major instead. Could we leave this here without the deprecation warnings?
content.html: We usually don't deprecate features on minor releases and do that on the next major instead. Could we leave this here without the deprecation warnings?

pullrequest.title: Remove TinyXML symbols from public API

content.raw: We also should make sure that changing to an alias is ABI compatible
content.html: We also should make sure that changing to an alias is ABI compatible

pullrequest.title: Remove TinyXML symbols from public API

content.raw: hmm, good point. I think what I did does change ABI. They symbols now have `internal` in their names. I think it'll work if we do the reverse where `URDF2SDF` is defined in namespace `sdf` with a deprecation and `internal::URDF2SDF` is an alias to `sdf::URDF2SDF`
content.html: hmm, good point. I think what I did does change ABI. They symbols now have internal in their names. I think it'll work if we do the reverse where URDF2SDF is defined in namespace sdf with a deprecation and internal::URDF2SDF is an alias to sdf::URDF2SDF

pullrequest.title: Remove TinyXML symbols from public API

content.raw:
I might have said this exact thing in the past, but now that I look at semver.org, it seems to indicated that things can be deprecated with a minor bump:

"Minor version Y (x.Y.z | x > 0) MUST be incremented if new, backwards compatible functionality is introduced to the public API. It MUST be incremented if any public API functionality is marked as deprecated."

* https://semver.org/#spec-item-7
content.html:
I might have said this exact thing in the past, but now that I look at semver.org, it seems to indicated that things can be deprecated with a minor bump:

"Minor version Y (x.Y.z | x > 0) MUST be incremented if new, backwards compatible functionality is introduced to the public API. It MUST be incremented if any public API functionality is marked as deprecated."

  • https://semver.org/#spec-item-7

pullrequest.title: Remove TinyXML symbols from public API

content.raw: Yeah, I've also been looking at this recently. But I think tick-tocking across major versions is more gentle on downstream users, especially considering that we do major releases more often than most projects. It's also what we've done in the past and probably what our users already expect. If we want to change this, I'd suggest we discuss it first, then only adopt it for upcoming versions.
content.html: Yeah, I've also been looking at this recently. But I think tick-tocking across major versions is more gentle on downstream users, especially considering that we do major releases more often than most projects. It's also what we've done in the past and probably what our users already expect. If we want to change this, I'd suggest we discuss it first, then only adopt it for upcoming versions.

pullrequest.title: Remove TinyXML symbols from public API

content.raw: I vote for our (undocumented) policy to continue being "_not to introduce warnings in a minor release_". But considering that SDF 9 is only 2 months old and will be around for at least 5 years, I'd be ok making an exception this time. Especially since this is not part of the "main" API. But I'd check internally with the rest of the team to see if anyone sees a problem with this.
content.html: I vote for our (undocumented) policy to continue being "not to introduce warnings in a minor release". But considering that SDF 9 is only 2 months old and will be around for at least 5 years, I'd be ok making an exception this time. Especially since this is not part of the "main" API. But I'd check internally with the rest of the team to see if anyone sees a problem with this.

pullrequest.title: Remove TinyXML symbols from public API

content.raw: Looks like the deprecated attribute applies through a type alias in clang, unlike GCC. I was trying to avoid this, but the only thing I can think of now is to suppress the warning at every location where URDF2SDF is used.
content.html: Looks like the deprecated attribute applies through a type alias in clang, unlike GCC. I was trying to avoid this, but the only thing I can think of now is to suppress the warning at every location where URDF2SDF is used.
